metadata.case_name: Delhi Cloth and General Mills Co. Ltd. v. Workmen

facts.text: Appellant is a public limited company owning and running various industrial units including Delhi Cloth Mills (D.C.M.) and Swatantra Bharat Mills (S.B.M.), both registered as factories under the Factories Act, engaged in cotton textiles.

Appellant prepares consolidated balance sheet and profit and loss account for all units, but maintains separate balance sheets and profit and loss accounts for individual units including D.C.M. and S.B.M.
Workmen of D.C.M. and S.B.M. have always been paid bonus calculated on the basis of pooled profits of the two units treating them as one unit.

Reference dated March 4, 1966 under ss. 10(1)(d) and 12(5) of Industrial Disputes Act by Delhi Administration Special Industrial Tribunal in Reference No. 53 of 1966 for adjudication of issues including fairness of allocation of capital and reserves to D.C.M. and S.B.M., and entitlement to bonus higher than 6% for accounting year ending 30-6-1965.

Settlement arrived between Management and Labour Unions on issue No.1: Balance-sheets of D.C.M. and S.B.M. taken together for available surplus per Payment of Bonus Act, 1965; specific provisions on interest, return on fixed capital (8.5%), gratuity reserves (6%), no unilateral change in method.
Gross profits per Second Schedule: D.C.M. Rs. 107.14 lakhs, S.B.M. Rs. 48.93 lakhs, total Rs. 156.09 lakhs. No dispute.
Statutory depreciation u/s 6(a): Rs. 35.83 lakhs total. No dispute.
Development rebate u/s 6(b): Rs. 2.72 lakhs total. No dispute.

Management calculation (Ex. M-330): Direct taxes u/s 6(c) - Income tax Rs. 52.24 lakhs, Surtax Rs. 5.48 lakhs, total Rs. 57.72 lakhs; Available surplus Rs. 37.35 lakhs; Allocable surplus (60%) Rs. 22.40 lakhs; Annual wage bill Rs. 306.32 lakhs; Bonus rate 7.31%.

Workers calculation (W-84): Direct taxes u/s 6(c) per Ex. M-15 Rs. 10.09 lakhs; Available surplus Rs. 118.74 - prior charges = Rs. 84.98 lakhs? Wait, chart shows adjustments leading to allocable surplus Rs. 50.99 lakhs; Bonus rate 16.64%.
Company total tax liability per Directors' report: Rs. 16.00 lakhs, proportioned in Ex. M-15 to D.C.M. Rs. 7.37 lakhs, S.B.M. Rs. 2.24 lakhs, total Rs. 10.09 lakhs? for units.
Award dated February 28, 1967 of Delhi Administration Special Industrial Tribunal.
Balance sheets and P&L for D.C.M. (Exs. M-5 to M-7), S.B.M. (Exs. M-8 to M-10).

legal_issues.text: Quantum of direct taxes deductible under s. 6(c) of the Payment of Bonus Act, 1965 for computing available surplus and bonus for D.C.M. and S.B.M. treated as one establishment.
Whether D.C.M. and S.B.M. are to be treated as separate establishments or together under s. 3 proviso of Payment of Bonus Act.

petitioner_arguments.text: Direct taxes under s.6(c) to be computed notionally on gross profits of the two units alone (Rs.156.09 lakhs minus depreciation and development rebate Rs.38.55 lakhs, tax at 45% Rs.52.24 lakhs + surtax Rs.5.48 lakhs = Rs.57.72 lakhs), leading to bonus at 7.31%.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Payment of Bonus Act, 1965 ss.3 proviso, 4,5,6,7; Income-tax Act principles for notional liability; Metal Box Co. v. Workmen

petitioner_arguments.text: Units with separate balance sheets treated as one establishment per settlement and history, but tax computed fictionally ignoring other units' losses/profits.

respondent_arguments.text: Direct taxes limited to proportional share from company total tax liability of Rs.16 lakhs per Ex. M-15 (Rs.10.09 lakhs), leading to higher bonus at 16.64%.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Payment of Bonus Act, 1965 s.6(c); actual tax per Income-tax Act

respondent_arguments.text: s.6(c) related to actual tax liability, not notional; reference to Full Bench formula, Sree Meenakshi Mills, Tulsidas Khimji.

court_reasoning.text: Under s.3 proviso, departments/units with separate balance sheets treated as separate establishments unless previously part of larger; here D.C.M. and S.B.M. treated together per history and settlement.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Gross profits, available surplus computed per Act fictionally for the establishment alone, ignoring other units.

court_reasoning.text: Direct tax u/s.6(c) is notional liability computed as if establishment is sole venture of employer, at rates under Income-tax Act but ignoring losses/exemptions from other years/activities per s.7; not actual company tax apportioned.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Agrees with Metal Box Co.: Tribunal computes hypothetical tax on establishment's income/profits.

court_reasoning.text: Ex. M-15 apportionment from company total Rs.16 lakhs irrelevant; must use notional on Rs.117.54 lakhs balance at 45% + surtax.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Management's Ex. M-330 correct; Tribunal erred using Ex. M-15.

court_reasoning.text: Act is complete code; pre-1965 Full Bench formula inapplicable; distinguishes cases like Alloy Steel where no profits.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Bonus based on establishment's results alone.

holdings.text: Direct taxes u/s.6(c) computed notionally on the establishment's (D.C.M.+S.B.M.) gross profits minus prior charges u/s.6(a),(b), ignoring other units and actual company tax liability.
D.C.M. and S.B.M. treated as one establishment for bonus computation per s.3 proviso and history.
Management's calculation in Ex. M-330 correct; bonus at 7.31% of annual wages.

precedents_cited.relevance: Direct taxes under s.6(c) computed notionally at Income-tax rates on establishment's income, not actual tax assessed.

precedents_cited.case_name: Sree Meenakshi Mills Ltd. v. Their Workmen
precedents_cited.relevance: Pre-Bonus Act Full Bench formula observations; held unnecessary post-1965 Act.

precedents_cited.case_name: Alloy Steel Project v. The Workmen
precedents_cited.relevance: Separate unit not part of larger company for bonus despite common ownership; no profits made.

statutes_cited.name: Payment of Bonus Act, 1965
statutes_cited.relevance: Computation of gross profits, available surplus, allocable surplus, direct taxes as prior charge notionally for establishment.

statutes_cited.name: Industrial Disputes Act, 1947
statutes_cited.relevance: Reference for adjudication of bonus dispute.

statutes_cited.name: Income-tax Act, 1961
statutes_cited.relevance: Basis for notional computation of depreciation, development rebate, direct tax liability.

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; Tribunal award set aside and modified to provide bonus at 7.31% as per management's calculation; at Court suggestion, modified to 10% of wages, payable before Diwali 1971, no interest; no order as to costs.
outcome.relief_granted: Bonus at 10% of wages for accounting year ending 30-6-1965.

key_quotes.text: "What s. 7 really means is that the Tribunal has to compute the direct taxes at the rates at which the income, gains and profits of the employer are taxed under the Income Tax Act... These words do not, however, mean that the Tribunal while computing direct taxes as a prior charge has to assess the actual taxable income and the taxes thereon."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core holding on notional computation of direct taxes from Metal Box, adopted here.

key_quotes.text: The employer is to be treated as a separate juristic person liable to pay bonus to the employees as if the establishment was his only venture, no matter how he fares in his other ventures.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Explains fictional treatment of establishment under the Act.

key_quotes.text: The Act is a complete Code and the provisions thereof must have effect of their own force.
key_quotes.speaker: court
